posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail fallander69

Great to read your build, it is a challenging build the Rogue / CoT / WM
CoT helps with saves which is a weakness of the Rogue / Fighter / WM
The artwork you have put in the post looks pretty scary! :)

Here are a few suggestions
SpoilerIt helps if you can write out the BAB and Base AB of the build with the mundane dwarven waraxe so we don't have to calculate it. Add 12 AB from Str 34, +4 from WF/EWF/EP and +3 from WM 16 = Base AB 46 It is pretty rough to level up a lowish dex rogue from 1-10 limited to light armor, no shields.  I would think about a Rogue 14 / CoT 10 / WM 16 level split perhaps for the bonus rogue feat. You could drop the Str a little if you are going one handed, perhaps to 30, and put stats elsewhere

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Strength based Rogue CoT WM is very ambitious both to build and to level up, I think it will be easier if you take Armor proficiency heavy once you have AP medium, but it can still be a tough journey up to that point with a low dexterity rogue in only light armor.

posts.author: fallander69
posts.content:
I'm levelling this guy rn on one of the PW's, currently level 8. With access to wands the levelling was almost painlessly! So thank you very much. 

I see no point in taking heavy armor there. Scale mail +5 with dex up via potion/spells will bring total ac 13, which is the same as full plate armor +4.  Also, heavy armor doesn't go with the theme.

It's not about playing the most OP builds ever been there, at least not all the time and not for me. I fixed the missing info in the first post. If moderator wish it can be transferred to finalised level 40 builds, thank you.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
I would be careful about posting finalized builds that have, as part of the premise, ease of levelling with "access to wands".  This is highly subjective and more often than not, not the norm.  The build need to stand on its own merits.  

As for the build itself, yes, you can get by with medium armor.  But the suggestion for heavy armor is a good one and not one to cast aside.  I also don't see the value in a 17th level of WM.  The character would be better served with another Rogue level.  With only one rogue level in Epics (39), that second rogue level would go a long way strategically placed at Level 27ish.

The other thought (instead of increasing Rogue) would be to put those 2 odd CoT levels (11-12) into WM for another bonus feat and another point of AB.

Finally, for Tumble, you can stop investing at Rank 40.  There's no return on the investment beyond that.

Cheers!
